item.description: System identification (from the SID parameter). Record: SMF99S2 Based on: SMF99SID Description System identification (from the SID parameter).

item.title: Field - sid
item.description: System identification (from the SID parameter). Record: SMF99S6 Based on: SMF99SID Description System identification (from the SID parameter).

item.title: Field - sl_query_response_code
item.description: Response code from the last ‘query’ for lpar information Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SL_QUERY_RESPONSE_CODE Description Response code from the last ‘query’ for lpar information

item.title: Field - sl_setcap_response_code
item.description: Response code from the last attempt to ‘set capping flags’ Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SL_SETCAP_RESPONSE_CODE Description Response code from the last attempt to ‘set capping flags’

item.title: Field - slavgmsu
item.description: Average service rate in millions of service units per hour. This is a long-term average. Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLAVGMSU Description Average service rate in millions of service units per hour. This is a long-term average.

item.title: Field - slavgmsucapped
item.description: Average service rate in millions of service units per hour while the partition was capped. This is a short-term average. Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLAVGMSUCAPPED Description Average service rate in millions of service units per hour while the partition was capped. This is a short-term average.

item.title: Field - slavgmsuuncapped
item.description: Average service rate in millions of service units per hour while the partition was uncapped. This is a short-term average Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLAVGMSUUNCAPPED Description Average service rate in millions of service units per hour while the partition was uncapped. This is a short-term average

item.title: Field - slcappedbycustomer
item.description: Indicates that the logical partition is configured to be capped (as opposed to being capped by WLM) Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: slconfigflags Description Indicates that the logical partition is configured to be capped (as opposed to being capped by WLM) Post-Processed This virtual field corresponds to the flag at bit-position 4 of field slconfigflags.

item.title: Field - slcappedbywlm
item.description: Indicates that the logical partition is capped by WLM. Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: slstateflags Description Indicates that the logical partition is capped by WLM. Post-Processed This virtual field corresponds to the flag at bit-position 0 of field slstateflags.

item.title: Field - slceccapacity
item.description: Capacity of CEC in millions of service units per hour. Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLCECCAPACITY Description Capacity of CEC in millions of service units per hour.

item.title: Field - slceccapacity_zcbp
item.description: Capacity of CEC in millions of service units per hour for zCBP Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLCECCAPACITY_ZCBP Description Capacity of CEC in millions of service units per hour for zCBP

item.title: Field - slceccpucount
item.description: Number of available CPUs in the CEC. This includes online and offline CPUs. It does not include reserved CPUs (CPUs that can be added via Capacity Upgrade on Demand). Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLCECCPUCOUNT Description Number of available CPUs in the CEC. This includes online and offline CPUs. It does not include reserved CPUs (CPUs that can be added via Capacity Upgrade on Demand).

item.title: Field - slceccpucount_zcbp
item.description: Number of available zCBPs in the CEC Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLCECCPUCOUNT_ZCBP Description Number of available zCBPs in the CEC

item.title: Field - slcecserviceunitspersectoshare
item.description: The CEC capacity in basic-mode service units per second that is available for sharing among partitions using shared logical processors. Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLCECSERVICEUNITSPERSECTOSHARE Description The CEC capacity in basic-mode service units per second that is available for sharing among partitions using shared logical processors.

item.title: Field - slconfigflags
item.description: Configuration flags Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLCONFIGFLAGS Description Configuration flags Flag fields This is a flag field with the following bit fields: Field Bit-Position Description slstsi 0 Indicates that the machine supports the store system information instruction. sllpar 1 Indicates that MVS is running in a logical partition slvm 2 Indicates that MVS is running in a virtual machine slhassharedlogicalcpus 3 Indicates that the logical CPUs are shared with other partitions slcappedbycustomer 4 Indicates that the logical partition is configured to be capped (as opposed to being capped by WLM)

item.title: Field - slhassharedlogicalcpus
item.description: Indicates that the logical CPUs are shared with other partitions Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: slconfigflags Description Indicates that the logical CPUs are shared with other partitions Post-Processed This virtual field corresponds to the flag at bit-position 3 of field slconfigflags.

item.title: Field - slices
item.description: Number of time slices that work in this group was capped Map: SMF99_S1_RG_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLICES Description Number of time slices that work in this group was capped

item.title: Field - slimgcapacity
item.description: Capacity available to MVS image in millions of service units per hour, when not running as VM guest. If running as VM guest, capacity available to VM. Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLIMGCAPACITY Description Capacity available to MVS image in millions of service units per hour, when not running as VM guest. If running as VM guest, capacity available to VM.

item.title: Field - slimgcapacity_zcbp
item.description: Capacity available to MVS image in millions of service units per hour for zCBP Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLIMGCAPACITY_ZCBP Description Capacity available to MVS image in millions of service units per hour for zCBP

item.title: Field - slimgcplimit
item.description: MVS image capacity in hundredths of processor units (100=1 CPU) Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLIMGCPLIMIT Description MVS image capacity in hundredths of processor units (100=1 CPU)

item.title: Field - slimgmsuatcurrentweight
item.description: MVS image capacity in millions of service units per hour that is represented by the partition’s current weight. Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLIMGMSUATCURRENTWEIGHT Description MVS image capacity in millions of service units per hour that is represented by the partition’s current weight.

item.title: Field - slintervalservice
item.description: Service units over last policy adjustment interval. NOTE: The service units are calculated using the MP factor for the number of physical CPUs, not the number of logical CPUs. This is consistent with how capacity is measured for software licensing. These service units cannot be directly compared to other service units calculated by SRM. Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLINTERVALSERVICE Description Service units over last policy adjustment interval. NOTE: The service units are calculated using the MP factor for the number of physical CPUs, not the number of logical CPUs.

item.title: Field - slintervalservice_zaap
item.description: ZAAP Service units over last policy adjustment interval. NOTE: The service units are calculated using the MP factor for the number of physical CPUs, not the number of logical CPUs. This is consistent with how capacity is measured for software licensing. These service units cannot be directly compared to other service units calculated by SRM. Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLINTERVALSERVICE_ZAAP Description ZAAP Service units over last policy adjustment interval. NOTE: The service units are calculated using the MP factor for the number of physical CPUs, not the number of logical CPUs.

item.title: Field - slintervalservice_ziip
item.description: ZIIP Service units over last policy adjustment interval. NOTE: The service units are calculated using the MP factor for the number of physical CPUs, not the number of logical CPUs. This is consistent with how capacity is measured for software licensing. These service units cannot be directly compared to other service units calculated by SRM. Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLINTERVALSERVICE_ZIIP Description ZIIP Service units over last policy adjustment interval. NOTE: The service units are calculated using the MP factor for the number of physical CPUs, not the number of logical CPUs.

item.title: Field - slintervalstocap
item.description: Number of consecutive policy adjustment intervals to cap the partition. Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLINTERVALSTOCAP Description Number of consecutive policy adjustment intervals to cap the partition.

item.title: Field - slintervalstouncap
item.description: Number of consecutive policy adjustment intervals to uncap the partition. Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLINTERVALSTOUNCAP Description Number of consecutive policy adjustment intervals to uncap the partition.

item.title: Field - slintervaltime
item.description: Elapsed time over last policy adjustment interval in 1.024 milliseconds Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLINTERVALTIME Description Elapsed time over last policy adjustment interval in 1.024 milliseconds

item.title: Field - slln
item.description: Length of the software licensing section Map: SMF99_S1_SDEF_MAP Based on: SMF99SLLN Description Length of the software licensing section

item.title: Field - sllogicalcpucount
item.description: Number of available CPUs in the logical partition. This includes online and offline CPUs. It does not include reserved CPUs (CPUs that can be added via Capacity Upgrade on Demand). Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLLOGICALCPUCOUNT Description Number of available CPUs in the logical partition. This includes online and offline CPUs. It does not include reserved CPUs (CPUs that can be added via Capacity Upgrade on Demand).

item.title: Field - sllogicalcpucount_zcbp
item.description: Number of available zCBPs in the LPAR Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLLOGICALCPUCOUNT_ZCBP Description Number of available zCBPs in the LPAR

item.title: Field - sllpar
item.description: Indicates that MVS is running in a logical partition Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: slconfigflags Description Indicates that MVS is running in a logical partition Post-Processed This virtual field corresponds to the flag at bit-position 1 of field slconfigflags.

item.title: Field - slof
item.description: Offset to the software licensing section from the beginning of the record (including RDW). Map: SMF99_S1_SDEF_MAP Based on: SMF99SLOF Description Offset to the software licensing section from the beginning of the record (including RDW).

item.title: Field - slon
item.description: Number of software licensing sections Map: SMF99_S1_SDEF_MAP Based on: SMF99SLON Description Number of software licensing sections

item.title: Field - slpatternintervalcount
item.description: Number of consecutive policy adjustment intervals that have passed in the current cap/uncap state indicated by SMF99_SLCap pedByWlm. Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLPATTERNINTERVALCOUNT Description Number of consecutive policy adjustment intervals that have passed in the current cap/uncap state indicated by SMF99_SLCap pedByWlm.

item.title: Field - slrollinterval
item.description: Number of policy adjustment intervals between computation of average service rate. Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLROLLINTERVAL Description Number of policy adjustment intervals between computation of average service rate.

item.title: Field - slservicetableintervals
item.description: Number of consecutive policy adjustment intervals that have passed since the last time that the service table was updated. Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLSERVICETABLEINTERVALS Description Number of consecutive policy adjustment intervals that have passed since the last time that the service table was updated.

item.title: Field - slstateflags
item.description: State flags. Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLSTATEFLAGS Description State flags. Flag fields This is a flag field with the following bit fields: Field Bit-Position Description slcappedbywlm 0 Indicates that the logical partition is capped by WLM.

item.title: Field - slstsi
item.description: Indicates that the machine supports the store system information instruction. Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: slconfigflags Description Indicates that the machine supports the store system information instruction. Post-Processed This virtual field corresponds to the flag at bit-position 0 of field slconfigflags.

item.title: Field - sltln
item.description: Length of the software licensing service table section Map: SMF99_S1_SDEF_MAP Based on: SMF99SLTLN Description Length of the software licensing service table section

item.title: Field - sltof
item.description: Offset to the software licensing service table section from the beginning of the record (including RDW). Map: SMF99_S1_SDEF_MAP Based on: SMF99SLTOF Description Offset to the software licensing service table section from the beginning of the record (including RDW).

item.title: Field - slton
item.description: Number of software licensing service table sections Map: SMF99_S1_SDEF_MAP Based on: SMF99SLTON Description Number of software licensing service table sections

item.title: Field - sltservicecapped
item.description: Basic-mode service units accumulated while the partition was capped. NOTE: The service units are calculated using the MP factor for the number of physical CPUs, not the number of logical CPUs. This is consistent with how capacity is measured for software licensing. These service units cannot be directly compared to other service units calculated in SRM. Map: SMF99_S1_SLT_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLTSERVICECAPPED Description Basic-mode service units accumulated while the partition was capped.

item.title: Field - sltservicecappedcount
item.description: Number of seconds that the partition was capped. Map: SMF99_S1_SLT_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLTSERVICECAPPEDCOUNT Description Number of seconds that the partition was capped.

item.title: Field - sltservicelastupdateinterval
item.description: Policy adjustment interval ID when this entry was last updated. Since the ID is only 1 byte, it will wrap multiple times over the course of the table. That is, the time span of the table is greater than 255 intervals so the interval IDs will wrap around. Map: SMF99_S1_SLT_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLTSERVICELASTUPDATEINTERVAL Description Policy adjustment interval ID when this entry was last updated. Since the ID is only 1 byte, it will wrap multiple times over the course of the table.

item.title: Field - sltserviceuncapped
item.description: Basic-mode service units accumulated while the partition was uncapped. NOTE: The service units are calculated using the MP factor for the number of physical CPUs, not the number of logical CPUs. This is consistent with how capacity is measuredfor software licensing. These service units cannot be directly compared to other service units calculated in SRM. Map: SMF99_S1_SLT_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLTSERVICEUNCAPPED Description Basic-mode service units accumulated while the partition was uncapped. NOTE: The service units are calculated using the MP factor for the number of physical CPUs, not the number of logical CPUs.

item.title: Field - sltserviceuncappedcount
item.description: Number of seconds that the partition was uncapped. Map: SMF99_S1_SLT_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLTSERVICEUNCAPPEDCOUNT Description Number of seconds that the partition was uncapped.

item.title: Field - sltserviceunusedgroupcapacity
item.description: Service units which would be allowed by the group capacity limit but are not consumed by the members of the group Map: SMF99_S1_SLT_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLTSERVICEUNUSEDGROUPCAPACITY Description Service units which would be allowed by the group capacity limit but are not consumed by the members of the group

item.title: Field - slunusedscaling
item.description: The scaling factor of unused group capacity which is stored in 48 buckets in the service table Map: SMF99_S1_SL_MAP Based on: SMF99_SLUNUSEDSCALING Description The scaling factor of unused group capacity which is stored in 48 buckets in the service table

item.title: Field - slv

item.title: Sample - smf_99_01_sample
item.description: Request for commonly used SMF 99 subtype 1 data. Sample fields The sample will fetch the following fields. Name Based on Description Type/Format cap_cec SMF99_FREE_LPAR_CAPACITY_CEC_RELATED Free LPAR capacity which is the total of what is always available to the LPAR and the portion of the unused capacity of the CEC integer cctrcwtr SMF99_CCTRCWTR Blocked workload, number of addr.space/ enclaves waiting longer than the threshold integer cp_imp2 virtual alias ilsu_array[2] CP service consumption for importance level 2 ziip_disc virtual alias ilsu_ziip_array[6] zIIP service consumption for importance discretionary ziip_imp1 virtual alias ilsu_ziip_array[1] zIIP service consumption for importance level 1 uic3 SMF99_UIC3 Frames in uic bucket 3 integer zaap_util processed SMF99_IFAA Average Utilization of assist processors, scaled by 16 integer cap_lcp SMF99_FREE_LPAR_CAPACITY_LCP_CONFIG Free LPAR capacity based on the configured LCPs integer cp_imp3 virtual alias ilsu_array[3] CP service consumption for importance level 3 cctrcuse SMF99_CCTRCUSE Blocked workload, number of trickles used in the current interval integer cp_imp5 virtual alias ilsu_array[5] CP service consumption for importance level 5 ziip_imp4 virtual alias ilsu_ziip_array[4] zIIP service consumption for importance level 4 cap_cec_ziip SMF99_FREE_LPAR_CAPACITY_CEC_RELATD_ZIIP Free zIIP LPAR capacity which is the total of what is always available to the LPAR and the portion of the unused zIIP capacity of the CEC integer cp_util processed SMF99_CPUA Average utilization of regular CPs, scaled by 16 integer sid SMF99SID System identification (from the SID parameter).

item.title: Sample - smf_99_02_sample
item.description: Request for commonly used SMF 99 Subtype 2 data. Sample fields The sample will fetch the following fields. Name Based on Description Type/Format ready_user_av SMF99_PRUA Ready user average integer mpl_delay SMF99_PMPLD MPL Delay integer buffer_pool_delay SMF99_PBPD buffer pool delay samples integer srv_class_name SMF99_CNAM service class name string mpl_in SMF99_PMPLI MPL in-target integer period_num SMF99_PNUM period number integer io_using SMF99_PIOU I/O using samples integer ziip_using SMF99_PSUPU SUP using samples integer zaap_delay SMF99_PIFAD IFA delay samples integer cap_delay SMF99_PCAPD CPU CAP delay integer samp_io_using SMF99_USING_IOSM_CURR DASD I/O using samples for the current interval integer ziip_delay SMF99_PSUPD SUP delay samples integer mpl_av SMF99_PAMTA Average Maximum MPL Target achieved integer disp_prio SMF99_PBDP base dispatching priority integer pi_local processed SMF99_PLPI local performance index integer samp_io_unit_queue SMF99_CUQT_IOSM_CURR DASD I/O control unit queue samples for the current interval integer cross_mem_delay SMF99_PXMO Cross memory other delays integer zaap_using SMF99_PIFAU IFA using samples integer samp_io_delay SMF99_DELAY_IOSM_CURR DASD I/O delay samples for the current interval integer idle SMF99_PIDLE idle samples integer sid SMF99SID System identification (from the SID parameter).

item.description: Request topology information per processor. Sample fields The sample will fetch the following fields. Name Based on Description Type/Format cp_cputype processed SMF99E_CP_CPUTYPE CPU/Core type integer topology_change virtual vcm_flag1 topology has changed honor_priority_change virtual vcm_flag1 honor priority has changed vcm_cpsperan SMF99E_VCM_CPSPERAN CPUs/Cores per affinity node integer cp_ci_nl3 SMF99E_CP_CI_NL3 Container ID of nesting level 3 integer hd_topochg_cpu_index SMF99E_HD_TOPOCHG_CPU_INDEX Logical CPU/Core number integer sid SMF99SID System identification (from the SID parameter). string cp_ci_nl2 SMF99E_CP_CI_NL2 Container ID of nesting level 2 integer speed_change virtual vcm_flag1 processor speed change mpwq_affinity_node SMF99E_MPWQ_AFFINITY_NODE affinity node this CPU/Core belongs to integer cp_ci_nl4 SMF99E_CP_CI_NL4 Container ID of nesting level 4 integer affinity_nodes_rebuild virtual vcm_flag1 rebuild affinity nodes cp_ci_nlinuse processed SMF99E_CP_CI_NLINUSE Number of highest nesting level in use in array SMF99E_CP_CI_NL.

item.title: Field - topology_change
item.description: topology has changed Map: SMF99_S14_HD_TOPOCHG_HDR_MAP Based on: vcm_flag1 Description topology has changed Post-Processed This virtual field corresponds to the flag at bit-position 0 of field vcm_flag1.

item.title: Field - tpid
item.description: Policy adjustment interval identifier Map: SMF99_S1_AAT_MAP Based on: SMF99_TPID Description Policy adjustment interval identifier

item.title: Field - trace
item.description: Policy adjustment action code Map: SMF99_S1_AAT_MAP Based on: SMF99_TCOD Description Policy adjustment action code

item.title: Field - trace_action
item.description: Policy adjustment action code Map: SMF99_S1_AAT_MAP Based on: trace Post-Processed The source values (SMF) are mapped in IBM SMF Explorer as follows: Source value IBM SMF Explorer meaning 105 add server 9180 QMPL recommendations not allowed 9190 No QMPL action 9191 Available auxilliary storage 9195 No QMPL action 9200 No QMPL action 9202 No QMPL action 9205 No QMPL action 9210 No QMPL action 9220 No QMPL action 9230 No QMPL action 9240 No QMPL action 9245 No QMPL action 9246 No QMPL action 9247 QMPL increase limited 9250 increase QMPL 9251 decrease QMPL 9260 increase QMPL 9261 decrease QMPL 9270 No QMPL action 9280 No QMPL action 9285 No QMPL action 9294 Limited number of initiators 9295 Start an initiator 9296 Limited number of initiators 9297 Impacted Period 9298 Period CPU assess will be reduced 9299 QMPL action

item.title: Field - trace_code
item.description: Policy adjustment action code Map: SMF99_S1_AAT_MAP Based on: trace Post-Processed The source values (SMF) are mapped in IBM SMF Explorer as follows: Source value IBM SMF Explorer meaning 105 RA_UU_ADD_SRV_GR 9180 QMPL_NA_REC QMPL 9190 QMPL_NA_STOR 9191 QMPL_AUX_STOR 9195 QMPL_NA_RUA0 9200 QMPL_NA_MPL 9202 QMPL_NA_IDLE 9205 QMPL_NA_QUEUE 9210 QMPL_NA_PEND 9220 QMPL_NA_UNMGED 9230 QMPL_NA_REC_RR 9240 QMPL_NA_REC_GR 9245 QMPL_NA_SYSLOC 9246 QMPL_NA_NOSYS 9247 QMPL_LIM_GSMAX 9250 INC_QMPL_GR 9251 DEC_QMPL_GR 9260 INC_QMPL_RR 9261 DEC_QMPL_RR 9270 QMPL_NA_NETVAL 9280 QMPL_NA_NO_REQ 9285 QMPL_NA_GSMAX 9294 PA_QMPL_LIMIT_AVT 9295 RA_INC_QMPL_AFF 9296 QMPL_LIMIT_NUM 9297 QMPL_IMPACT_PER 9298 QMPL_CPU_DON 9299 QMPL_INC_GSMAX

item.title: Field - trace_details
item.description: Policy adjustment action code Map: SMF99_S1_AAT_MAP Based on: trace Post-Processed The source values (SMF) are mapped in IBM SMF Explorer as follows: Source value IBM SMF Explorer meaning 105 resource adjustment, underutilized 9190 critical shortage condition exists 9191 for server spaces 9195 ready user average is zero 9200 MPL problem exists 9202 idle inits observed 9205 resource period isn’t a queue server 9210 previous QMPL recommendation(s) exists 9220 unmanaged queue 9230 no receiver value 9240 no receiver value 9245 better system to start initiators available 9246 no system to start initiators 9247 resource group maximum reached 9250 for queue servers, goal receiver 9251 for queue servers, goal receiver 9260 for queue servers, resource receiver 9261 for queue servers, resource receiver 9270 insufficient net value for queue servers 9280 no queued requests 9285 to increase resource group service maximum 9294 to the number of available AS - 10 9295 for a batch work queue due to specific affinity requirement 9296 to not the doubled number of current initiators 9297 by starting the initiators on this system 9298 by adding initiators on this system 9299 to increase resource group service maximum

item.title: Field - uic1
item.description: Frames in uic bucket 1 - The central and expanded UIC buckets contain a count of frames that have not been referenced for specified periods of time. So, UIC bucket 1 is a count of the frames that have most recently been referenced, where bucket 4 contains a count of the frames that have not been referenced in a long time. The UIC delimiter values specify the cutoff points for each bucket .

item.title: Field - vcm_diagcapdecr
item.description: Capacity decrease flags Map: SMF99_S12_HD_INT_CAP_MAP Based on: SMF99C_VCM_DIAGCAPDECR Description Capacity decrease flags Flag fields This is a flag field with the following bit fields: Field Bit-Position Description vcm_diagdecr 0 Adjust capacity decrease vcm_diagdecrdiscrpark 1 Adjust capacity decrease by parking a processor vcm_diagdecrdiscrparequ 2 Park requested vcm_diagdecrdiscrpaallrq 3 Park all request vcm_diagdecrbusythr 4 MvsBusy too low vcm_diagdecreffectthr 5 VL effect too low vcm_diagdecreffectsmall 6 small VM/VL effectiveness vcm_diagdecreffectnone 7 no VM/VL effectiveness vcm_diagdecrefflowthr 8 if no VH exists vcm_diagnodecrlowutil 9 No capacity decrease adjustment.

item.title: Field - vcm_diagcapdecr_cont
item.description: Capacity decrease flags continuation Map: SMF99_S12_HD_INT_CAP_MAP Based on: SMF99C_VCM_DIAGCAPDECR_CONT Description Capacity decrease flags continuation Flag fields This is a flag field with the following bit fields: Field Bit-Position Description vcm_diagdecrparkallful 0 Park all request. Free capacity unpark threshold at or above upper limit vcm_diagnodecrprsmcaplowutil 1 PR/SM capped LPAR: No capacity decrease adjustment. Reason: Low CEC utilization

item.title: Field - vcm_diagcapincr
item.description: Capacity increase flags Map: SMF99_S12_HD_INT_CAP_MAP Based on: SMF99C_VCM_DIAGCAPINCR Description Capacity increase flags Flag fields This is a flag field with the following bit fields: Field Bit-Position Description vcm_diagincr 0 Adjust capacity increase vcm_diagincrdiscrunpark 1 Adjust capacity increase by unparking a processor vcm_diagincrdiscruprequ 2 Unpark request vcm_diagincrdiscrupallrq 3 Unpark all request vcm_diagincrunusedcap 5 unpark requested because the LPAR capacity is below the guaranteed capacity + unused capacity share vcm_diagincrprsmcapvhutil 6 PR/SM capped LPAR: Unpark requested because of high VH utilization

item.title: Field - vcm_errorcode

item.description: VCM error code Map: SMF99_S14_HD_TOPOCHG_HDR_MAP Based on: SMF99E_VCM_ERRORCODE Description VCM error code

item.title: Field - vcm_flag1
item.description: HD 1st flag byte Map: SMF99_S12_HD_INT_HDR_MAP Based on: SMF99C_VCM_FLAG1 Description HD 1st flag byte Flag fields This is a flag field with the following bit fields: Field Bit-Position Description vcm_topochanged 0 topology has changed vcm_rebuildans 1 rebuild affinity nodes vcm_topochg_hp 2 honor priority has changed vcm_topochg_wuqe 3 dispatcher WUQ error vcm_procspeedchg 4 processor speed change

item.title: Field - vcm_flag1
item.description: balancer interval flag1 Map: SMF99_S14_HD_TOPOCHG_HDR_MAP Based on: SMF99E_VCM_FLAG1 Description balancer interval flag1 Flag fields This is a flag field with the following bit fields: Field Bit-Position Description topology_change 0 topology has changed affinity_nodes_rebuild 1 rebuild affinity nodes honor_priority_change 2 honor priority has changed wuq_error 3 dispatcher WUQ error speed_change 4 processor speed change

item.title: Field - vcm_flag2
item.description: HD 2nd flag byte Map: SMF99_S12_HD_INT_HDR_MAP Based on: SMF99C_VCM_FLAG2 Description HD 2nd flag byte Flag fields This is a flag field with the following bit fields: Field Bit-Position Description vcm_ceccapvalid 0 CEC capacities are valid vcm_lparcapvalid 1 LPAR capacities are valid vcm_old_state 2 old VCM state vcm_mpwq_updated 4 dispatcher affinity was updated vcm_ptf_switched 5 PTF was issued to initiate a switch into the opposite mode. However, the PTF return info tells us that we are already in the requested mode vcm_transition 6 VCM is transitioning to/from vertical

item.title: Field - vcm_flag2
item.description: balancer interval flag2 Map: SMF99_S14_HD_TOPOCHG_HDR_MAP Based on: SMF99E_VCM_FLAG2 Description balancer interval flag2 Flag fields This is a flag field with the following bit fields: Field Bit-Position Description vcm_ceccapvalid 0 CEC capacities are valid vcm_lparcapvalid 1 LPAR capacities are valid vcm_old_state 2 old VCM state vcm_mpwq_updated 4 dispatcher affinity was updated vcm_ptf_switched 5 PTF was issued to initiate a switch opposite mode. However, the PTF return info tells us that we are already in the requested mode vcm_transition 6 VCM in transition to/from vertical

item.title: Field - vcm_flag3
item.description: HD 3rd flag byte Map: SMF99_S12_HD_INT_HDR_MAP Based on: SMF99C_VCM_FLAG3 Description HD 3rd flag byte Flag fields This is a flag field with the following bit fields: Field Bit-Position Description vcm_topofac 0 topology facility installed vcm_ifafac 1 IFA facility installed vcm_lpardedicps 2 LPAR has only dedicated CPUs/Cores vcm_cmset_active 3 Cross memory set vcm_newconttle 4 new container TLE vcm_smf_topochg 6 Write TopoChg section

item.title: Field - vcm_flag4
item.description: HD 4th flag byte Map: SMF99_S12_HD_INT_HDR_MAP Based on: SMF99C_VCM_FLAG4 Description HD 4th flag byte Flag fields This is a flag field with the following bit fields: Field Bit-Position Description vcm_old_ifa_hp 0 IFA honor priority state of previous interval vcm_old_sup_hp 1 SUP honor priority state of previous interval

item.description: zAAP service consumption for importance level 1 Map: SMF99_S1_SS_MAP Based on: ilsu_zaap_array[1] Description “Description of the array: A single entry in the array of Importance Level Service Units, containing the number of Service Units consumed by work at this Importance Level (or unused) over the last ten seconds. The entries are indexed with an origin of zero so that the index matches the Importance Level to which the entry pertains.”

Field - ziip_imp1
item.description: zIIP service consumption for importance level 1 Map: SMF99_S1_SS_MAP Based on: ilsu_ziip_array[1] Description “Description of the array: A single entry in the array of Importance Level Service Units, containing the number of Service Units consumed by work at this Importance Level (or unused) over the last ten seconds. The entries are indexed with an origin of zero so that the index matches the Importance Level to which the entry pertains.”
